trans-unit.source: dotnet-pack
trans-unit.target: dotnet-pack

trans-unit.source: dotnet-pack
trans-unit.target: dotnet-pack

trans-unit.source: .NET, .NET Core
trans-unit.target: .NET, .NET Core

trans-unit.source: dotnet-pack
trans-unit.target: dotnet-pack

trans-unit.source: NAME
trans-unit.target: NAME

trans-unit.source: - Packs the code into a NuGet package
trans-unit.target: - Packs the code into a NuGet package

trans-unit.source: SYNOPSIS
trans-unit.target: SYNOPSIS

trans-unit.source: DESCRIPTION
trans-unit.target: DESCRIPTION

trans-unit.source: The `dotnet pack` command builds the project and creates NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: The `dotnet pack` command builds the project and creates NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: The result of this operation is two packages with the `nupkg` extension.
trans-unit.target: The result of this operation is two packages with the `nupkg` extension.

trans-unit.source: One package contains the code and the other contains the debug symbols.
trans-unit.target: One package contains the code and the other contains the debug symbols.

trans-unit.source: NuGet dependencies of the project being packed are added to the nuspec file, so they are able to be resolved when the package is installed.
trans-unit.target: NuGet dependencies of the project being packed are added to the nuspec file, so they are able to be resolved when the package is installed.

trans-unit.source: Project-to-project references are not packaged inside the project by default.
trans-unit.target: Project-to-project references are not packaged inside the project by default.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to do this, you need to reference the required project in your dependencies node with a `type` set to "build" like in the following example:
trans-unit.target: If you wish to do this, you need to reference the required project in your dependencies node with a `type` set to "build" like in the following example:

trans-unit.source: by default first builds the project.
trans-unit.target: by default first builds the project.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to avoid this, pass the `--no-build` option.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to avoid this, pass the `--no-build` option.

trans-unit.source: This can be useful in Continuous Integration (CI) build scenarios in which you know the code was just previously built, for example.
trans-unit.target: This can be useful in Continuous Integration (CI) build scenarios in which you know the code was just previously built, for example.

trans-unit.source: OPTIONS
trans-unit.target: OPTIONS

trans-unit.source: The project to pack.
trans-unit.target: The project to pack.

trans-unit.source: It can be either a path to a `project.json` file or to a directory.
trans-unit.target: It can be either a path to a `project.json` file or to a directory.

trans-unit.source: If omitted, it will default to the current directory.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, it will default to the current directory.

trans-unit.source: , `--output` [DIR]
trans-unit.target: , `--output` [DIR]

trans-unit.source: Places the built packages in the directory specified.
trans-unit.target: Places the built packages in the directory specified.

trans-unit.source: Skips the building phase of the packing process.
trans-unit.target: Skips the building phase of the packing process.

trans-unit.source: Places the temporary build artifacts in the specified directory.
trans-unit.target: Places the temporary build artifacts in the specified directory.

trans-unit.source: By default, they go to the obj directory in the current directory.
trans-unit.target: By default, they go to the obj directory in the current directory.

trans-unit.source: Configuration to use when building the project.
trans-unit.target: Configuration to use when building the project.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, will default to "Debug".
trans-unit.target: If not specified, will default to "Debug".

trans-unit.source: Updates the star in `-*` package version suffix with a specified string.
trans-unit.target: Updates the star in `-*` package version suffix with a specified string.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLES
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLES

trans-unit.source: Packs the current project.
trans-unit.target: Packs the current project.

trans-unit.source: Packs the app1 project.
trans-unit.target: Packs the app1 project.

trans-unit.source: Packs the current project and place the resulting packages into the specified folder.
trans-unit.target: Packs the current project and place the resulting packages into the specified folder.

trans-unit.source: Packs the current project into the specified folder and skips the build step.
trans-unit.target: Packs the current project into the specified folder and skips the build step.

trans-unit.source: Packs the current project and updates the resulting packages version with the given suffix.
trans-unit.target: Packs the current project and updates the resulting packages version with the given suffix.

trans-unit.source: E.g.
trans-unit.target: E.g.

trans-unit.source: version `1.0.0-*` will be updated to `1.0.0-ci-1234`.
trans-unit.target: version `1.0.0-*` will be updated to `1.0.0-ci-1234`.
